alert.note: Alert for Boone; Cole; Moniteau (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 23 at 8:41PM CDT until September 23 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Cole County in central Missouri... Southwestern Boone County in central Missouri... Moniteau County in central Missouri... * Until 930 PM CDT. * At 840 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Rocheport to near McGirk to near Eldon, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Columbia, Russellville, Jamestown, Centertown, and McGirk around 845 PM CDT. Easley around 850 PM CDT. St. Martins around 855 PM CDT. Hickory Hill around 900 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Jefferson City, Ashland and Brazito. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 117 and 131. This also includes Rock Bridge State Park and Jewell Cemetery Historic Site. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
